games.necrowar

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • joueur.BaseGame
      • games.necrowar.Game

  • public class Game
extends joueur.BaseGame
    Send hordes of the undead at your opponent while defending yourself against theirs to win.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Player currentPlayer
      The player whose turn it is currently.
      int currentTurn
      The current turn number, starting at 0 for the first player's turn.
      static java.lang.String gameVersion
      The hash of the game version we have locally.
      int goldIncomePerUnit
      The amount of gold income per turn per unit in a mine.
      int islandIncomePerUnit
      The amount of gold income per turn per unit in the island mine.
      int manaIncomePerUnit
      The Amount of gold income per turn per unit fishing on the river side.
      int mapHeight
      The number of Tiles in the map along the y (vertical) axis.
      int mapWidth
      The number of Tiles in the map along the x (horizontal) axis.
      int maxTurns
      The maximum number of turns before the game will automatically end.
      java.util.List<Player> players
      List of all the players in the game.
      int riverPhase
      The amount of turns it takes between the river changing phases.
      java.lang.String session
      A unique identifier for the game instance that is being played.
      java.util.List<Tile> tiles
      All the tiles in the map, stored in Row-major order.

      The amount of time (in nano-seconds) added after each player performs a turn.

    • Field Detail

      • currentPlayer

        public Player currentPlayer
        The player whose turn it is currently. That player can send commands. Other players cannot.

      • currentTurn

        public int currentTurn
        The current turn number, starting at 0 for the first player's turn.

      • goldIncomePerUnit

        public int goldIncomePerUnit
        The amount of gold income per turn per unit in a mine.

      • islandIncomePerUnit

        public int islandIncomePerUnit
        The amount of gold income per turn per unit in the island mine.

      • manaIncomePerUnit

        public int manaIncomePerUnit
        The Amount of gold income per turn per unit fishing on the river side.

      • mapHeight

        public int mapHeight
        The number of Tiles in the map along the y (vertical) axis.

      • mapWidth

        public int mapWidth
        The number of Tiles in the map along the x (horizontal) axis.

      • maxTurns

        public int maxTurns
        The maximum number of turns before the game will automatically end.

      • players

        public java.util.List<Player> players
        List of all the players in the game.

      • riverPhase

        public int riverPhase
        The amount of turns it takes between the river changing phases.

      • session

        public java.lang.String session
        A unique identifier for the game instance that is being played.

      • tiles

        public java.util.List<Tile> tiles
        All the tiles in the map, stored in Row-major order. Use `x + y * mapWidth` to access the correct index.

      • timeAddedPerTurn

        public int timeAddedPerTurn
        The amount of time (in nano-seconds) added after each player performs a turn.

      • towerJobs

        public java.util.List<TowerJob> towerJobs
        A list of every tower type / job.

      • towers

        public java.util.List<Tower> towers
        Every Tower in the game.

      • unitJobs

        public java.util.List<UnitJob> unitJobs
        A list of every unit type / job.

      • units

        public java.util.List<Unit> units
        Every Unit in the game.

      • gameVersion

        public static final java.lang.String gameVersion
        The hash of the game version we have locally. Used to compare to the game server's game version.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getTileAt

        public Tile getTileAt(int x,
                      int y)
        Gets the Tile at a specified (x, y) position
        Parameters:
        x - integer between 0 and the mapWidth
        y - integer between 0 and the mapHeight
        Returns:
        the Tile at (x, y) or null if out of bounds
